string.text: Shortened barrel
A shorter barrel leaves the gun lighter and more compact, at the cost of lower accuracy and wider shot dispersion. It also prohibits the use of a suppressor.
Barrel bluing
Bluing the barrel results in higher resistance against the elements and other environmental hazards, increasing reliability.
Revision of the barrel bore
Increases muzzle velocity for a faster time-to-target and reduces trajectory deviation. Useful for engagements at longer ranges.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Wear-resistant trigger components
Replacing the various parts of the trigger assembly with equivalents made from more durable materials improves the overall longevity of the weapon.
Tactical grip
Installation of an underbarrel grip makes the gun easier to handle and control, allowing for better recoil compensation.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment of the trigger components improves overall accuracy.
Combined tactical module
Combines the functions of a narrow-field tactical flashlight and laser sight. Particularly useful in low-light conditions.
Expanded magazine tube
Replacing the standard magazine tube with a higher-capacity variant means fewer reloads during combat and improves the odds of survival.
Mount a tactical rail
Allows for the installation of various optics on the weapon.
Recoil compensator
Adding a special polymer damper to the internal assembly slightly reduces the recoil generated by each firing cycle.
Balance the trigger group
Balancing the various trigger assembly components has an improved effect on recoil.
Install a hardened extractor
Improves overall reliability of the weapon by reducing the number of common ejection issues that can occur after firing.
Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Tactical buttstock
Significantly improves the shooter's ability to handle and aim the weapon, resulting in better accuracy.
Soft trigger release
Reduces recoil, which in turn leads to more accurate follow-up shots.
Lightweight alloy components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight alloys significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
Chamber alignment
Careful fitment of parts and minimization of backlash in the chamber for a better seal, improving accuracy.
Threaded suppressor mount
Threading the end of the barrel allows a suppressor to be mounted.
Barrel alignment
Calibrate barrel alignment with the sights and remove any excessive movement that occurs during the firing cycle, resulting in improved accuracy.
